p: During early stages of SARS infection, IFN-γ presence is associated with viral clearance and infection resolution; IFN-γ is synthesized mainly by activated T cells and natural killer (NK) cells ( 79). IFN-γ (type II) and IFN-α/β (type I) have synergistic actions; given alone neither inhibits viral replication, but administration of both inhibited viral replication by 3000-fold at 24 h, with stronger inhibition at 48 and 72 h.
